description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB Provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21370), users should apply the relevant updates as outlined below:

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit).
2. Download and install the appropriate KB update from Microsoft:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5034766](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766)
   - For Windows 10 (x64 and 32-bit): [KB5034774](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034774)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
3. Restart your system post-update installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- The vulnerability is associated with a heap-based buffer overflow that could allow for remote code execution.
- Ensure your system is updated to the latest build version to mitigate potential risks effectively.

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm that you are running a compatible Windows version as specified in the update documentation.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation to avoid any potential data loss.
